fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: Electronic Arts Interchange File Format 1985 (EA IFF 85)
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description: Generic wrapper format developed for data interchange and interoperability.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Generic wrapper format developed for data interchange and interoperability.

fdd:relationship.fdd:comment: Direct Stream Digital Interchange File Format, Version 1.5
Wrappers for other applications, not documented here

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:disclosure: Fully documented. Developed by Electronic Arts.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:documentation: EA IFF documentation is provided online by various third parties.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Unknown to the compilers of this document; see also AIFF.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:transparency: Transparent wrapper. Transparency of bitstreams within subtypes varies; for example, see LCPM and DSD.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:selfDocumentation: The format includes headers and identifiers associated with various "chunks," as the elements within the file are called. These headers contain encoded information (as specified) used to characterize the chunk's role and characteristics.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:techProtection: None known to the compilers of this document.

fdd:values.fdd:note: See http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/power/library/pa-spec16/?ca=dgr-lnxw07IFF. Chunk IDs are discussed in http://www.martinreddy.net/gfx/2d/IFF.txt.

fdd:history.p: The format was brought to completion in 1985 by the electronic gaming company Electronic Arts; some of the information about IFF refers to the Commodore-Amiga computer company and three Commodore-Amiga staff members are listed as co-authors of a key piece of documentation. An outline of the history of Electronic Arts is provided by Wikipedia.
The IFF format was influential and is cited as the source of ideas and approach by the creators of other tagged formats, e.g., RIFF and SMF.

fdd:urlReference.comment: The 1985 specification, from a third party

fdd:urlReference.tag: Interchange File Format (EA IFF) entry in Wikipedia
Standards and specs: The Interchange File Format (IFF)

fdd:urlGroup.fdd:intro: The Encyclopedia of Graphic File Formats, 2nd Edition, 1996 (EGFF) has information on this format. See print citation below. Online access is available at:

fdd:urlReference.comment: From FileFormat.Info. This presentation states that the work has been released under a Creative Commons Attribution license.
From FileFormat.Info, via Internet Archive's Wayback Machine. Included because FileFormat.info has not been updated recently (as of November 2012) and was not functioning for a period.

fdd:citation.fdd:bookReference: Murray, James D. and William vanRyper. Encyclopedia of Graphics File Formats, 2nd Edition. Sebastopol, CA. : O'Reilly & Associates, 1996. Includes CD-ROM with complete text of book, and copies of several file format specifications.
